This lesson will provide you with the information you will need to:
Identify the introduction that should be used when greeting customers over the phone.
Comply with and meet QA expectations associated with phone greetings/introduction.
Reviewing the new standard introduction formats.
Outlining the steps associated with determining the appropriate greeting.
There are two introduction formats that can be used when greeting customers over the phone:
If we have the customer’s information, Simply ask if they are the person we think the are and continue!
“Hi, I’m {{your name}} with Instacart Care. Am I speaking with {name on account}?”
{if yes...} Great! How can I help you today?
{if no...} Okay. Can you please provide the phone number for your account so I can verify your information?
Only use the customer’s email to verify their identity if they do not know their phone number.
If we don’t have the customer’s information, Simply ask for their phone number and continue!
“Hi, I’m {{your name}} with Instacart Care. “Before we begin, please provide the phone number for your account.”
Only use the customer’s email to verify their identity if they do not know their phone number.
